title: Where exactly does the damage from on hit Yi come from? Not a complaint im curious
body: they build low ad items (to my memory) like {{item:1416}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3091}} {{item:3022}} {{item:3026}} + a tank item or {{item:3508}}  and end up being able to put out a frankly absurd amount of damage if left unchecked. How does that even work? I remember Crit yi which obviously explains the damage. But if someone basically reduces your resistances to 0 but basically has not that muchdamage how does that even add up. I know Conqueror + his passive but still

replies.body: Rageblade and his passive feed off each other. Rageblade helps him stack his passive faster and his passive helps him stack rageblade faster. Essentially when he autos you twice, he applies on-hits four times instead of two including his E
Oh okay that makes sense. I thought i just wasn't tanky enough. so im guessing buy {{item:3110}}

So then get a warmogs? Or build enough damage to kill him before he kills you? {{champion:39}}
His E, and his Q reset, add a shitton of damage to on-hit Yi, especially with Guinsoo's.
High base stats + His E true damage (and passive bonus) + His passive
It is his insane attack speed with those items, all the on hits adding up, and his Q cooldown due to autos and kills which gives him insane damage.

The build is Red smite razor, into guinsoos, essense, stormrazor, finished boots, and then like a wit's end or frozen mallet. All the AD you can add up from that is quite a lot. With Ult, Q and e, you get Yi.
